item.description:
If you need to read the synopsis of David Lynch's adaptation of Frank Herbert's cult science fiction novel, you can do so at the event website:  http://www.realartways.org/cinema.htm#dune     (1984, USA, 137 mins)

The lecture will be by Peter Turchin, one of the top cited authors in the field of Ecology/Environment and a founder of cliodynamics, the new scientific discipline located at the intersection of historical macrosociology, cliometrics, and mathematical modeling of social processes. Turchin developed an original theory explaining how large historical empires evolve by the mechanism of multilevel selection.

 

Admission:
Real Art Ways Members: $5 (the same price since 1996!)
Seniors & Students Members: $4.50
Regular Admission (non-members): $10
Seniors (62+) / Students (full-time with ID): $7

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Science on Screen: "DUNE" @ RAW
